stories.text:
I am a bachelor graduate and I’ve almost finished my MSc in computer science, I had this startup idea in mind for a year now but I don’t know if it is in my interest at the moment to purse this thing.

In the past month I’ve tried to send my CV to some big companies but nobody reached back, I feel the pressure that I must find a job as soon as possible because otherwise I will be too old to be interesting for companies. This is what it’s holding me back at the moment.

I am afraid that if I carry on with the startup idea and then fail my experience in the field will not be considered as “good” as the same period of time spent in a good company that has a big background and reputation.

So, if there’s some recruiters in here, how do you value a CV with no previous experience but maybe a year of two trying to raise a failed startup (ages <30)?

Don't get me wrong, I would love to try the startup thing and I am very motivated and passionate for software engineering, but I also have to consider the downsides so that I can take responsibility for whatever I choose
stories.title: Ask HN: Is experience in raising a startup valuable in a CV for a soft. eng.?
